author: s1na
content: And yet these methods are used widely in the clients. There are other classes of users to a client than a dapp. The UX of `eth_fillTransaction` is IMO much better as the output of that can be taken directly to the signer. I think introducing a new method for blob proofs is worse UX.

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree that `eth_fillTransaction` is useful.  My argument is only that it shouldn't be a requirement to properly implement an Ethereum Client's JSON-RPC.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would rather see such useful code be put into a library or something and have Ethereum Clients focus only on the lowest-level of interactions with the underlying blockchain.

author: s1na
content: I can stand behind a way to spec "optional" API methods. They already exist in some form. E.g. `trace_` namespace is implemented and agreed on by most clients, but not all (geth is the outlier here). But not specced. I think we're losing out by not having a spec for those.

author: .fjl
content: I have another hot spec topic for you guys today

author: .fjl
content: I have noticed in hive tests that besu, nethermind and reth return the RLP encoding of receipts from `debug_getRawReceipts`

author: .fjl
content: go-ethereum returns the 'consensus encoding', ie. `tx-type || payload`

author: .fjl
content: we generally use the 'consensus encoding' in the RPC spec

author: .fjl
content: for eth_sendRawTransaction, we use the consensus encoding
